intro: Eugenia harmandii, commonly known as the Harmand’s guava, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by edible, pinkish-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for local use.
